replies.commentBody:
Nixon probably really believed it when he said it.

Not this crowd, they know it.

comments.commentBody: How different is all this from Nixon's allegation:  "I am not a crook."
Is lying to Congress a crime? Has Sessions lied to Congress (therefore, to the people)?

Obama knew the nature of the snakes moving into the White House. All the Trump staffer lies were based on the idea that they could bury any intelligence reports that proved they lied. Obama trumped them.

The allegation that Russian meddled in the 2016 election by hacking Democratic National Committee email is based on an intelligence report that provides no real evidence of Russian tampering. As the New York Times in January reported, “The report provides no new evidence to support assertions that Moscow meddled covertly through hacking and other actions to boost the electoral chances of Donald J. Trump and undermine his rival, Hillary Clinton, but rests instead on what it describes as Moscow’s long record of trying to influence America’s political system.” At any rate, most voters don’t even know what the DNC reveal. It revealed that the DNC rigged the Democratic primary against Bernie Sanders. Wouldn’t it make more sense to assume the hacker’s motives was to help Bernie Sanders, not Donald Trump?  The email scandal that hurt Clinton and helped Trump wasn’t the DNC email, but the classified email stored on her home server.

I think we all know who also has transcripts of every call and every meeting between the Trump lackeys and the Russians "known to the intelligence community", and for a man like Vladimir Vladimirovitch, those transcripts will go to the highest bidder.  Trump is fool,  a national security risk, and this is exactly why the Kremlin wanted him in the Oval Office.  He is a puppet and easy to manipulate.

What you don't hear is, what role did Trump play in the Russian Connection.
If we put the pieces together, Trump has never condemned Russia for anything. In fact he thinks it would be great if we could work together. He said he never had contact but went on record before cameras saying he did. Trump doesn't believe the Russians hacked the DNC to influence the election. And, all those that were in contact with the Russians were his closest most loyal advisors. Now we hear denials all over the place. To me that smells of collusion.

Sessions was not asked if he met.  He was asked what he would do about those who may have, and he came out with an unsolicited lie.  Any detective, heck, any school teacher knows what happened there.  The notion that a half dozen GOP proxies on the news this morning know what brain fog Sessions was in while testifying to be the highest ranking LEO in the country is utter nonsense.

We need to have a full investigation of the Russian influence in this election and a full accountability of the role Trump advisors or appointed played in this matter. This is a  matter of nation's security. The actions of people like Sessions and others are acts of treason and should be punished to the fullest extent possible. The greatest effort should be made to force the living dinosaur himself Mitch McConnell and that boob Paul Ryan to force public hearings on this matter.  A key player in this matter has to be the FBI Director himself. He must fearlessly lead the way into this matter and investigate; leave no stone unturned in getting to the bottom of this. As a side note Comey must have a hard time sleeping at night knowing that he was instrumental in getting this self aroused buffoon Trump elected  president.

This newspaper has shamed itself, the American people know better than your crude propaganda attempts to discredit our President. The Obama administration and its' fellow travelers at the NYT/DNC Propaganda Department have been beating this drum for the last year with the same result, the people don't believe a word you print. Despite the relentless attacks Trump is prevailing with the public and moving forward. Not a word from you crusading "journalists" for 8 years while the entire executive branch is politicized beyond recognition but after a month of a viscous, premeditated smear campaign to thwart the will of the people and magically restore credibility to this fallen newspaper we have to endure more manufactured obfuscation of the fact that the Obama "pure as the driven snow" White House tried in the 11th hour to taint Trump and match the chosen narrative of the NYT/DNC. If you think this horse manure will have any effect other than to further the marginalization of both the NYT and the Democratic party, think again. People are truly sick and tired of this partisan drivel as transparent as the sanctimonious claims of fairness and objectivity, obsessively repeated as if true.

Here's the bottom line: the only calculus that congressional Republicans are making here is, what's best for them. Not what's best for the country, but what's best for them. And eventually they will realize that being on the wrong side of history regarding a U.S. President who clearly has ties - very extensive, very deep, and possibly criminal ties - to Vladimir Putin and Russia will look a whole lot worse for them in the long run than abandoning a President from their own party will.

Where there's smoke, there's fire. This one's burning.

I hear much talk of hacking the election, disrupting democracy and other high-holy pontificating. What information was hacked: emails revealing that the DNC coluded with media to sabotage Sen Sanders and to feed Mrs. Clinton debate questions? Democracy was not assaulted by whomever hacked; rather the DNC and the Clinton campaign were exposed as idiots and as treacherous conspirators who, among other things, orchestrated paid violence at Trump rallies to construct a narrative of his incitement. So let's focus on the content of what was hacked and the vile behavior of the DNC and not pretend that Trump got Russians to hack voting machines. Democratic desperation is the only headline here.
Thank you for this story.  We all know what happened.  The question now: how do we get rid of this group of criminals sitting in the White House?

I hear the slow drip of corruption
torturing the Trump Administration.
There is a lot of squirming going on
for there to be No there "there"
The question is how high up
the ladder does the conspiracy go ?

I am so pleased President Obama did this. Positively the right thing to do--and a real act of patriotism. Preserving this information was so essential to the integrity of our elections. We are a representative democracy and our elections processes are so important to this country. Our elections are how we stay a representative democracy.

So this is really why Mr DJ Trump stated he accept the results of the election IF he won.
and
It's why he goes out of his way to BRAND the NYT as "fake".

Why Republicans have been such craven cowards in this matter is a mystery to me.  Maybe its naive of me, but I really believed my dad, a WWII vet, when he said that Americans "are the good guys." And I thought all Americans cared about the security of the country (and not "trumped" up issues to be cured by an absurdly expensive and useless wall.)  If I lived in Wisconsin Paul Ryan would have to face his lack of real leadership in the Congress on this very important issue before and during his next campaign for re-election.  I do not understand the lack of interest in the so called Republican base.  Where is their awareness of the real dangers posed by the kleptocracy that is Russia today?  Ryan is so interested in sticking it to the public on medicare and social security without, he believes, real opposition, that he is willing to turn a blind eye to the very real threat posed by this administration to our national interest.

Tired of this being dangled bit by bit. If there are tapes then they or transcripts should be released. Period. We don't need to fund an intelligence community that seems to be confused that they are here to help protect the United States, not a certain party, not a certain person, but our country.
Release the tapes. Release the information. Press, do your job.

We knew it all along. Paul Manafart. Oh Pleeze.
And he won because the sheeple in this country have been ill served by the media cause it's owned by the powers that be. They are easily brainwashed.The Putin connections are so clear. Faux news will ill inform his base.
Thank you nytimes for the information.

replies.commentBody:
Flynn and his supporters tried a similar tactic, maybe he shouldn't of resigned so quickly.

Maybe his boss shouldn't of accepted it almost as quick.

comments.commentBody: Who is making these allegations,  where is the evidence?  Anonymous  sources again, something this newspaper thrives on along with rumor and innuendoes.  Until their is substantial evidence this smear must shop!  As for former President Obama, if anyone is interfering with President Trump and his administration  its Obama using his group, Organizing For America and its organs  to disrupt and discredit Republican members of Congress and to torpedo President Trump!

I am probably the millionth person to make this observation, but just ponder for a moment the reaction of the Republicans if Hillary were in office and all of this were coming to light about her cabinet picks and her surrogates.

They squeezed eight or nine pointless congressional investigations out of one unfortunate but flukey incident in Benghazi; I imagine if HRC's pick to lead the justice department had lied under oath and met secretly with Russians, we'd be looking at about $1 billion in investigatory spending lasting the next eight years.

Republican is synonymous for mendacious, opportunistic hypocrite.

If President Trump and his associates have nothing to hide, he should be calling the loudest for a full and independent investigation that would clear his name once and for all and provide our government and intelligence services with insights that will help us prevent Russian meddling in the future.  Why isn't he doing this?

It's not about leaks, it's about external influences on our government and country and the lies. Regardless of your political affiliation, this is about our country, not politicians who will say or do anything to retain their perceived power.

Whatever options the Democratic leadership have to get Sessions out, they need to exercise them. The appointment of Sessions was bad enough, but this is just over the top. When will the establishment Democrats grow a spine and actually do something, like not show up for quorum and threaten a government shutdown?
This is what the democrat party / Soros is all about.

replies.commentBody:
It certainly is foolish to believe our govt could be in bed with the Kremlin at the highest levels, minus one of course.

Flynn quit before he remembered where his reserved parking space was.

comments.commentBody: It is ;time to bring this foolishness to a halt.  The democrats are going after the Trump administration one after another in a brazen attempt to bring it down.  It must be brought to a stop.  If it isn't, Obama will finish wrecking the country completely.  In the past republicans have turned on their own and have given in to the democrats' demands.  Now that must stop.  This attack on Jeff Sessions must be ignored just like the democrats ignored the contempt of Eric Holder and the charges against Hillary.  It is time to investigate Obama and expose all the lies and crimes in his background.  The democrats should be forced to explain exactly what the Russians are supposed to have done to hack the election.  If it is leaking the emails, then why haven't the democrats denied the contents of the leaked emails?  Obama and the democrats should admit the Russians did not make Hillary a bad candidate.  She did that all by herself.
